intro: Flaveria chlorifolia, commonly known as the greenleaf flaveria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces small, elongated fruits known as achenes. Flaveria chlorifolia is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
